Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Visiting Research Fellow Institute for the Study of Labor (IZA), Bonn.

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: European Association of Labour Economists (EALE) Conference, Oslo
European Association of Labour Economists (EALE) Conference, Oslo
European Society of Population Economics (ESPE) Conference, UCL, London
Xth International Academic Conference on Economic and Social Development, Higher School of Economics, Moscow
Fourth IZA/World Bank Conference on Employment and Development, Bonn
11th IZA/CEPR European Summer Symposium in Labour Economics (ESSLE), Buch/Ammersee.
XIth International Academic Conference on Economic and Social Development, Higher School of Economics, Moscow
8th IZA/World Bank Conference on Employment and Development, Bonn.
XXIX Italian Association of Labour Economists, AIEL , Pisa
10th IZA/World Bank Conference on Employment and Development, Bonn.
IZA/OECD/World Bank/UCW Workshop: Job Quality in Post-transition, Emerging and Developing Countries.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: IZA project “Study on the Social and Labour Market Integration of Ethnic Minorities” (funded by: European Commission. Contract reference No: VC/2006/0309). Scientific role: Participant/ Member of the Core Research Team.
“IZA projects on informal employment in Georgia and Russia” (funded by: Volkswagen Foundation and Fritz Thyssen Foundation). Scientific role: Participant.
Short-term Consultant to the OECD (analysis of labor market trends in Latvia for the OECD Report on Latvia 2016).

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Paper “The Costs of Job Loss in Russia” (with Hartmut Lehmann, Alexander Muravyev and Tiziano Razzolini) is honorably mentioned (nomination among 4 other papers) by the Award Committee of the Russia’s National Prize in Applied Economics 2012.

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: Novembre 2012, 2013, Aprile 2014, Febbraio 2015, 2016: Due lezioni su " unemployment and migration" come parte del corso Economia del lavoro(Dottorato), Università di Modena e Reggio Emilia, Facultà di Economia “Marco Biagi”/ Fondazione “Marco Biagi”.
